column1: #Text=Tom had the choice of two routes in making his voyage to far-off Siberia .
#Text=He could have crossed the United States , sailed over the Pacific ocean , and approached the land of the Czar from the western coast above Manchuria .
#Text=But he preferred to take the Atlantic route , crossing Europe , and so sailing over Russia proper to get to his destination .
#Text=The water voyage was somewhat shorter , and this was an important consideration when there was no telling when he might have an accident that would compel him to descend .
#Text=On the Atlantic he knew there would be more ships to render assistance if it was needed , although he hoped he would not have to ask for it .
#Text=" Then , too , " he said to Ned , when they were discussing the matter , " we will have a chance to see some civilized countries if we cross Europe , and we may land near Paris .

column1: #Text=" Not that we will be out when we arrive , but if we take on more there we may not have to get any in Russia .

#Text= exclaimed Mr. Damon , about noon of the second day , when they had just finished dinner and looked down through the glass windows in the bottom of the cabin at the rolling ocean below them .

_	_	_	_

#Text= I 'm sure they do not , " added Mr. Petrofsky .

column1: #Text=" I can hardly think it true , that I am on my way back to Siberia to rescue my dear brother .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= And such good weather as we 're having , " spoke Ned .

column1: #Text=" I 'm glad we did n't start off in a storm , for I do n't exactly like them when we 're over the water .

#Text= We may get one yet , " said Tom .
